title: Drawing, "Design for a Jardiniere", ca. 1855
medium: Pencil, brush and ink, watercolor, tempera colors, gold on tracing paper, tipped down.
creditline: Museum purchase from Pauline Riggs Noyes Fund
description: The body of the jardiniere is of blue porcelain, with a central field containing a spray of roses against a light background, wihin a narrow gold frame.  Mounted on a bronze base, composed of scroll legs joined by swags. Bronze handles and enframements.  Flowers in the jardiniere.  Inscribed lower center: "No 639/Jardiniere ovale porcelaine et bronze long. 53c larg. 24c. haut. 26c. largeuer 24c.  Assiette ronde pour dessert."
